page.title: 01Farming, Hellangove Farm
page.content: Size 150 acres, 7 acres woodland. Mainly in grass in the simmer and winter feed=fodder beat (also silage available). Mainly diary but introducing beef. Hereford bull and Fresian cow. Herd of 98. Calving is December-February/March. Drying up of cows is July-December. During the time when the Castle-An-Dinas Quarry adjacent to Hellangove was working sediment appeared in the milk. The milk was unsaleable and the herd had to be destroyed. Legal action was taken against the Amalgamated Roadstone Company owners of the quarry - as it was thought that quarry dust was the basic cause with resulting acid rain. The adjoining woods also appeared dead, but once the quarry closed, 'bloomed' again. Machines do much of the work on the farm today. Labourers have dwindled to one.
